comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per the accompanying caption, this pic might have been taken at an Anniversary Regatta on Sydney Harbour. The regatta was held on what is now Australia Day. If this is correct, then there's a good chance this pic was taken on a regatta flagship. Stanley Bruce was Australian Prime Minister from February 1923 to October 1929. In this time, the various newspaper reports indicate he attended the Anniversary Regatta in Sydney on two occasions, 1926 and 1929. The 1926 regatta flagship was RMS Orvieto, the 1929 regatta flagship was the RMS Orsova (both Orient Line ships). The various newspaper reports always listed the first tier VIPs who attended the Anniversary Regatta. Cullen appears to have attended the regatta in his capacity as Lieutenant-Governor of NSW throughout the 1920s - so he was present at both the regattas which Bruce attended. Here's his ADB entry plus portrait - adb.anu.edu.au/biography/cullen-sir-william-portus-5838 Beyond tentatively identifying Cullen, I've drawn a blank with the others in this pic. I suspect two of the chaps in nautical attire might be regatta organising officials. Someone who's up to speed on naval insignia might be able to come up with a list of 'possibles' for the other two. The chap beside Bruce looks as if he might be holding an official programme...but there's probably not enough resolution in the original negative for us to be able to read what's on the cover...though if we are looking at the front cover, then it appears not to be the 1926 programme...which appears in this PDF (p. 10) www.australiadayregatta.com.au/PDF/172nd%20ADR%20program%... ; so maybe this is the 1929 regatta...there's evidently a copy of the 1929 programme in a collection at the Mitchell Library if anyone who lives nearby feels inclined to check it out. But for all we know this chap might be holding the luncheon menu! news.google.com/newspapers?id=_7RVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=LJYDA... the Sydney Mail's brief item on the 1929 regatta A FEW DAYS LATER... After a bit more searching (via the long way around as usual) I've now managed to tentatively identify the chap on the lhs as Alfred Spain (1868-1954)...who was one of those earlier to mid 20th century Sydney figures who had an interest in just about everything (including yachting)...he appears in quite a few pics in the SLNSW collection acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=9312 ; at the 1946 regatta (here he's identified) acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=28347 ; at the 1949 regatta (pics possibly taken on board the regatta flagship HMAS Australia) acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=30264 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=30250 ; here's his ADB entry adb.anu.edu.au/biography/spain-alfred-8594 ; Spain was a member of the Royal Sydney Yacht Squadron and over the years also held various positions on the Anniversary Day regatta committee...he was chairman/vice-president in 1929...per the digitised newspapers, he attended the 1929 regatta...but I'm still trying to confirm whether he was at the 1926 regatta (presumably he was)...if this were 1926 I'd expect to see A.G. Milson among the VIPs...in 1926 Milson was the prime mover in the Anniversary Day regatta committee...he died in January 1928...so the fact that we don't see Milson here again suggests 1929...here's the SMH report on the 1929 regatta which lists the VIPs who attended nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16526493

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Fantastic research! I am sidetracked by Colonel A Spain though, particularly as my first thought was that the man second from right holding the programme, was him instead. This photo in particular looks like him. This photo also looks like him, more so than the man to the left. Plus this album is also interesting. See photo 12, caption says '[Colonel Bruxner, Judge Alfred Paxton Backhouse, the Captain and Colonel A.Spain and party at the Anniversary Regatta, 1937]'. Judge Backhouse is third from left in bowler hat, Colonel Bruxner is second from left, the Captain centre and then Colonel A Spain second from right. Regarding it being a regatta flagship, we thought so too, not just because of the presence of VIPs, but because of the flags in the background. By the way, great spotting in terms of the programme!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Whilst I wouldn't want to be too emphatic that I've identified Spain correctly, I'm still keeping my monthly gambling allowance (the whole $2.20) on the chap on the left. I reckon he's even wearing the same jacket in this pic acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=9312 . I doubt there'd be too many people still around who knew these 1920s and 1930s yachting identities, who might be a bit more certain re who is who in the various pics. For what it's worth, I suspect these yachties liked being snapped by Sam Hood.

I think that probably the case re the yachties! :)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6217115 ? looks to have been taken on the same occasion...if the Fairfax Collection pic caption is correct, then that's Governor General Lord Stonehaven next to PM Stanley Bruce. Three down, four and a half to go! At this rate we'll identify them all by 2020!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, as things stand, I count Col. Spain as only half identified (!)...I'm hoping another pic will emerge to prove my theory. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article115692704 1929 Evening News item which mentions Spain and other Anniversary Regatta officials.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] nla.gov.au/nla.news-article123161515 [a few hours later] Ha!...the Gilgandra Weekly to the rescue! The GW is a recent addition to the NLA digitised newspaper stable...what an excellent choice! All up, I'd say the Gilgandra Weekly pic confirms that this Sam Hood pic was taken on RMS Orsova during the 1929 Anniversary Regatta...presumably in Sydney Harbour (per the SMH report the Orsova was anchored in Neutral Bay). The digs seen in the GW pic are: Judge Backhouse, PM Stanley Bruce, D.L. Dowdell (Australian Orient Line general manager), Sir William Cullen, Lord Stonehaven, Archbishop Wright, NSW Premier Bavin, Col. Spain. As is evident, not all of them appear in the Sam Hood pic...I'd say there's now no doubt re Cullen...and I'd also suggest Col. Spain is now looking good (!)...it's a bit hard to tell, but I don't think the Archbishop or the Premier make it into Sam Hood's pic...the chap in the lighter suit wearing a bow-tie might be D.L. (Douglas) Dowdell, the Orient Line Australian branch general manager...looks like Judge Backhouse doesn't make it into Sam Hood's pic either... here's another pic of Dowdell wearing a bow-tie nla.gov.au/nla.news-article4003076 ; and a non bow-tie pic nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17234580 not yet quite convinced that's him in the Sam Hood pic...it's a pity the chap behind Col. Spain is obscured...he looks to have the then Rear Admiral's insignia on his epaulette (crown, crossed baton & sword, one larger star...thanks wikipedia!)...the obvious candidate is Rear-Admiral Evans...he's on the SMH list of digs who attended the regatta; I suspect the chap wearing what looks like an Orient Line cap might be Captain G.G. Thorne, then captain of the Orsova nla.gov.au/nla.news-article54175855 ; nla.gov.au/nla.news-article40822482 but that's also a speculator...I'm also beginning to suspect that the chap speaking to Lord Stonehaven might be John Garlick, then Sydney Chief Civic Commissioner, who the SMH indicates was president of the 1929 Anniversary Day Regatta committee...in many pics he's wearing specs, but not in all of them...most pics I've looked at are unconvincing eg acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=190560 ...but this one stops me crossing him off the list just yet nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6216876 ...in the Fairfax Collection pic we see then Brigadier-General Gordon Bennett (a Sydney Civic Commissioner) www.awm.gov.au/collection/011303/09/ , Rear-Admiral Evans, John Garlick and NSW MLA R.T. Ball acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=10021 ...looks like the Fairfax Collection pic might have been taken at the civic reception given to Evans upon his arrival in Sydney in May 1929 news.google.com/newspapers?id=D7VVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=LJYDA... ...at least there's one 'possible' we can cross off the list...per the newspaper reports, then NSW Governor Sir Dudley de Chair had been overseas and didn't return to Sydney until ?2 February 1929, about a week after this pic was taken. Of course de Chair is usually easy to identify, so that's hardly a bonus. ...can't wait till the West Wyalong Warbler is digitised!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Nice one!! I also thought the bow-tie chap was D.L. (Douglas) Dowdell based on the links you provided. Same look really. Also think you may be correct re Evans, Thorne and Garlick. Well done!! Records updated. :)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6297184 here's a pic of D.L. Dowdell from the wonderful Fairfax Collection (which has been digitised and is now progressively being made available via Trove)...I'd say there's now no doubt that's Dowdell in the Sam Hood pic. nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6217115 Fairfax Collection pic of Stanley Bruce and Lord Stonehaven at the 1929 Regatta

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-page14573641 and a pic from the recently digitised Sunday Times which shores up a few more identities...maybe Thorne and Evans aren't yet 100% certainties, but I think all the others now are... there can't be too much doubt re Garlick...dozens of pics of him appeared in the Sydney newspapers during his term as a Civic Commissioner, and the resemblance is strong...Dowdell is now 100%...Col Spain is also done and dusted! ...if anyone is interested, the Sunday Times has a couple of postage stamp sized pics taken at the 1929 Anniversary Regatta on the next page.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] thanks for sharing the extra pics! Great to see more newspapers being digitised. I'm excited by all the new information that will become available and all the photographs that will therefore be unlocked :) So great to identify faces within our collection, thank you so much quasymody!
